title: How come a 1/21 zed with all tears doesn't get banned for inting yet people do for toxicity
body: I just had this person in my game. The match with the image was played yesterday, so no punishment was given out. How come someone can do this, actually ruining a game, and get off free when someone else can be invested in the game, have someone make a mistake, and flame them and get banned? It just doesn't make sense to me. League is the only competitive game I can think of that punishes players that want to win and try to win for letting their emotions show, all the while not banning people that intentionally throw or ruin games. This is honestly ruining league for me, I have so many games where people like the zed ruin games for me and it bothers me so fucking much. I really just wish riot would do something about their terrible punishment system.

replies.body: Did he actually build that during the game? Or did he sell his items and buy them when it ended?

> [{quoted}](name=Galizien,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=FcrYRY9M,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2018-03-04T20:58:56.195+0000)
>
> I found the match, he was building normally then sold everything about 3 minutes before the game ended.
> 
> It's a really tough call, it could just be someone tilting out of the face of the Earth.
> 
> Without a replay and seeing if he said something incriminating in chat it's too hard to say.
> 
> No system, and maybe not even a person, can make an easy call on these type of cases unless they're stupid and say they're inting.

He gave up around 26th minute of a 46 minute game (+2 cs in 20 minutes), by no means it's a "tough call", in this case the system is just crap. And it wouldn't be the first time.

this. I don't get how trolls can prevail. Infact they seem to punish afk more than straight trolling

> [{quoted}](name=Galizien,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=FcrYRY9M,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2018-03-04T20:58:56.195+0000)
>

> 
> It's a really tough call, it could just be someone tilting out of the face of the Earth.
> 
> Without a replay and seeing if he said something incriminating in chat it's too hard to say.
> 
> No system, and maybe not even a person, can make an easy call on these type of cases unless they're stupid and say they're inting.

130 cs at 45 minute game..NO POSSIBLE

plus 1/21/1 NOT POSSIBLE in 45 minutes game if he was trying he would have at least ASSISTS or 1-2 kills he is playing zed...he has no assists no kills no CS so he was just walking mid and dying or he was alone in side lanes "farming" and just dying from the enemy


CLEARY A TROLL...

When someone gets behind, they very commonly do one of two things - try to split push as fast as they can (forgoing last hitting in favor of just pushing the lane fast) or they tilt and they forget to last hit altogether.

It is not "CLEARLY" as you put it - we would need much more data to determine.

I don't know if we are playing two different games, but that doesn't happen in my experience whatsoever. When someone falls behind, they may end up dying in lane, but never do I see anyone trying to splitpush as fast as they can or "forget to last hit". Thats just silly.

I don't understand how you can possibly defend someone going 1/21/1 in Ranked with a 4% kill participation.

Because KDA is not the be all end all. I have had games where I've died over 20 times. I have had very low kill participation in some of those games probably. That does **not** mean I was inting.

People are so quick to jump on "inting" or "trolling" just because they don't want to accept that they just lost a game. As others have said, there is *much* more data that would need to be looked at to definitively say inting or not here.

> [{quoted}](name=Chermorg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=FcrYRY9M,comment-id=000000010001000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-04T22:20:52.987+0000)
>
> Because KDA is not the be all end all. I have had games where I've died over 20 times. I have had very low kill participation in some of those games probably. That does **not** mean I was inting.
> 
> People are so quick to jump on "inting" or "trolling" just because they don't want to accept that they just lost a game. As others have said, there is *much* more data that would need to be looked at to definitively say inting or not here.

If you're not actively trying to improve and learn what you did wrong, fixing the mistakes that led to your death. If you're repeating the same death pattern over and over, dying 20 or more times just because "Idk they got me lul", you ARE inting. You've effectively stopped caring, admit it or not.

You do this in ranked, you get 100% reported by me. Because that's not how competition works.

> [{quoted}](name=NorthernRedStar,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=FcrYRY9M,comment-id=0000000100010000000000000002,timestamp=2018-03-05T02:39:11.610+0000)
> If you're not actively trying to improve and learn what you did wrong, fixing the mistakes that led to your death. If you're repeating the same death pattern over and over, dying 20 or more times just because "Idk they got me lul", you ARE inting. 

That's not Intentional Feeding. That's just being really shitty at playing LoL. "Inting" is running straight down the lanes  into the enemy turrets, or just standing there and letting them kill you without doing anything. Unless the player actually went into that death-incurring situation thinking "I want them to kill me", it's not intentional. 

 That said... the crucial part of the KDA to look at is the Assists. Even if you're absolute shite at Zed, even if you have NO CLUE what you're doing... you should at least be able to hit SOMEONE with SOMETHING at SOME POINT in a team fight, which means assists. Plural. Only 1 assist in a 45 minute match indicates Zed was actively trying to avoid grouping with his entire team which, combined with the 1/21 kill-death ratio, does mean trolling is the most likely reason.

GG this is the new age system

This should be a permanent ban straight away. As a silver player ive laned against guys in platinum sometimes and ive never even gotten close to 1 and 21 with 134 cs @ 45 mins. If you go 0 and 5 in lane you should just play safe not die over and over again. If you do you are clearly losing the game for your team and should be banned instantly especially with 130 cs at 45 mins. There is no excuse for this level of feeding especially in ranked, you just ruined the entire game for your team and wasted 45 mins that couldve been used playing a fun match. The fact that the moderators can defend this animal but will insta ban someone for using the word "%%%" shows the level of sjw mentality that has permeated Riot and is ruining the gaming experience.

^this
agree with everything, and the fact that some1 like Chermorg is defending stuff like this is...idk what to say....I'm just dissapointed

Chermog isn't defending inting, he's patiently trying to explain the difference between "**Intentional **Feeding" and ordinary feeding to a group of angry people who don't want to listen.

The insistence on trying to tell people not to jump to conclusions... I'll admit, I'm not sure why he keeps repeating that.

Look at his cs he wasn't splitting lmao, and even with the forgetting to last hit thing 3 cs per minute as a mid laner is abysmal, especially on someone who can clear a wave with 1 rotation of abilities
Just remember he died 21 time, you have to be alive to CS =').
What about the 1/21 score?

> [{quoted}](name=Galizien,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=FcrYRY9M,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2018-03-04T22:12:41.367+0000)
>
> I'm sure if we could easily look into really low bronze games there would be plenty of people with like 2/27 that absolutely tried their best.
> 
> There are so many games played every day, so many factors, that there's plenty of room for huge outliers.
> 
> My view? there was at least some toxic behavior here, I don't think the guy went in with the intent to int but at some point he more or less gave up and just started mindlessly fighting. But it could have been just outright inting from the start.
> 
> That's why I laugh when people say "but why Riot doesn't ban all those inters, so easy", because look at a case like that. My gut instinct tells me this guy may deserve some punishment at least, but how can we know for sure? and false bans are a huge nightmare for a company.

If you're 2/27 you did NOT try your best lmao. That'd involve aiming to minimize your death count, and getting some gold for items, for starters.

That score is just flatout inting, a CLEAR indication you stopped caring at some point in the game, and CHOSE to become a burden for your teammates, effectively ruining their game because you didn't get to be the one carrying.

People do this all the time, just better the higher they are. Masking their scores, making it look like they're trying a bit here and there. You have to be hella naive to think someone's playing that bad and trying to the best of their ability.

> [{quoted}](name=Galizien,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=FcrYRY9M,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2018-03-04T20:58:56.195+0000)

And you'd be a pure idiot if you didn't realize people exploit this kind of shit. (not calling you an idiot)
Not sure, i checked his opgg when he said he was inting at the start of my game then proceeded to go 1/8
I looked into this. Looks like Zed was building AD and attack speed and at the 41 minute mark, he abandoned everything for tears.
"just a bad game"
i agree

The crazy thing is the people here are more concerned with when he built the tears rather than the fact that he's, you know, 1/21/1 in ranked with 4% KP and 3 CS per minute. There should be some sort of punishment for that. That guy should not be allowed to play Ranked.

> [{quoted}](name=The Big Piece,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=FcrYRY9M,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2018-03-04T21:38:33.947+0000)

I don't understand how someone can legitimately think the guy's just tilted or having a bad game. You're telling me you regularly see people feed like no tomorrow in your games, because 'bad games happen to all of us'?

This Zed player is one of the reasons we even have flaming in the first place. I can mute someone who annoys me. I can't stop a troll from feeding.

Get real, people.

> [{quoted}](name=NorthernRedStar,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=FcrYRY9M,comment-id=0002000000000001,timestamp=2018-03-05T02:28:04.742+0000)

> This Zed player is one of the reasons we even have flaming in the first place. I can mute someone who annoys me. I can't stop a troll from feeding.
> 

I wish I could print this, frame it, and send to Riot HQ

should all people in bronze get banned then?
like literally?
should about 30% of the game population get banned or at least, "not allowed to play ranked" as far as you are concerned?

you want to avoid players like him, climb up. The higher you are, the lower chance to meet someone like him (or her)

Normal people don't go 1/21/1 with 4% kill participation even in Bronze. Its evidently clear the Zed was trolling/inting and if you think that doesn't happen in higher ranks you are sadly mistaken.

Its quite absurd if you truly believe that 30% of the games population has games like that. They don't.

oh yeh they do, and they do it quite often

the thing is: the guy played against better opponent
he probably got flamed by his team from the get go
he tilted
he said to himself "go fuck yourselves"
and didn't give a shit for the rest of the game, effectively playing at 50% or less of his capacity. Which ofc, means the better enemy will kill him over and over and over again.

while i do get its a ranked game and all that, not everyone is good at this game, and not everyone is trying their best 100%
that's why you get messages like: toxic people lose 20% more games, because once you are an asshole, you are making your team mates try less than 100% and this happens at all elos

bronze in particular is filled with smurfs and bad players, which means, the chance of someone playing much worse than they are capable of, is very high
so, lets ban all bronzies?

if this guy had a streak of constantly doing this thing (dying a lot, with like no cs), then yes. Banning him for a day or three is a good idea, to help him "cool down". But if its one game or two..... might as well ban everyone in the lower divisions.

> while i do get its a ranked game and all that, not everyone is good at this game, and not everyone is trying their best 100%

Then don't play ranked. Simple. Ranked is for tryhards. Casuals have a space, too.

I don't know 100% if he should be banned, but honestly, if you're going 1 and 21 and you're not already bronze 5 the system should auto demote you because you're simply not ready for the elo you're in. Like honestly...

"You can't prove a 1/21/1 kda is inting." Just because he kept trying to 1v1 the kat he fed all game... well, you don't KNOW you are going to lose the 1v1 just because you did the last 10 times you tried it vs that person in the same game. You might not be smart enough to realize that you can't pull off a slick zed move and grab a kill 1v3 under the enemy's nose. And even if you fail, at least you stacked those tears - you're just scaling for late game am I right? Lol.

See, the problem is people forgive intentional feeders to no end. Had a post exploring this topic awhile back and got downvoted to oblivion by "snowflakes" as some would say. The best commentary on that thread was when a player defined inting, then I used their definition to diagnose how someone doing exactly what I'd described (like forcing and losing a 1v1 or 2v2 for the 10th time instead of just sitting back and farming safely until they catch up/can get help from teammates) fit perfectly their definition of intentional feeding. The person's response was basically - that's not intentional feeding. Really, when it fits your exact definition of intentional feeding, it's not intentional feeding? Does society let someone drive drunk 10x and get in car accidents - injuring or killing other people and keep saying... it must have been a mistake, keep your driver's license? No. But you can do exactly that in league. People are just freaking ridiculous.

You can say whatever the hell you want to teammates or do whatever you want to harass them all game. Just don't type certain words and the system won't punish you. Then go and report the person you harassed for 25 min because he accurately tells you you are an idiot for flaming him for: going 2/3/1 in a shitty matchup while being camped the entire laning phase, not teleporting into a losing 3v5 you forced after he told you NOT to engage (when you also don't give a tp ward to begin with), die 1v2 because you ignore the 3x he pings you NOT to gank his lane RIGHT NOW (wait for a whole 5 sec so he can clear minions and get spells back off cd), etc. You can make that person's life hell and rather than you getting punished for it, he will get punished because you convince a teammate or opponent to help you report him for toxicity (and harass him with you all game). Then said player goes on the boards, explains the entire scenario (kinda like I just did here - but sub me into the spot of the guy being harassed all game), and the boards will claim "you're just toxic feeder" and crap like that.

It amazes me how much people will rally behind stupidity and assholes. How you can play for 1.5 seasons where 50+% of games you have intentional feeders and/or assholes harassing you all game, yet the only person who is punished is the guy who is most correct and trying his best to HELP his teammates. God forbid some asshole asks his teammates to ward for 20 min straight because none of them ward and are getting picked off for it. Heaven forbid a guy reply to a toxic teammate who doesn't understand the game and explain how ganking through a giant minion wave to force a 2v2 on an opponent of higher level (because you have tons of xp and cs to soak under tower - via the 25minion wave) to try to help his teammate understand the game better and make GOOD decisions. Or that you ping a teammate to NOT invade right at that moment because they will get 3 man collapsed on with no support from top or mid due to minion wave location and/or back timers. Then the jungler forces invade anyways and dies for 5th time for no gain exactly like you warned them would happen. Only a toxic asshole would warn his jungler of something like that or try to explain it so they STOP doing it. Jungler has every right to harass their teammate the entire game and belittle them for trying to help them see the flaw in their invade timings and get them to do a better play instead lol. Of course reading this, we see how flawed the jungler is for thinking something like that, yet in game, it's the toplaner who is punished. Because 20 min of trying to save teammates from stupid plays like that and getting harassed by his teammates who for some stupid reason think the jungler is correct makes him reply to their toxicity with some of his own. Sure, he could mute, but it's hard to communicate, and he did his best to have FAITH that just maybe his teammates could eventually see reason - after 10+ times of their strategies failing and his strategies working despite massive gold and item deficits the two times they actually listened to him. But no, just another auto-loss thanks to teammates too blind, arrogant, and toxic to open their eyes and realize all the hurtful stuff they claim about their toplaner is actually what they themselves are. And rather than flame them the entire game like they did to him, he gave them the benefit of the doubt, put up with their bullshit, and even tried their sure-to-fail strategies a dozen times if only to give them the chance and to prove that their strategies wouldn't work and MAYBE just maybe they should try listening to him.

Not like if you had an analyst, caster, lcs player, or coach they would tell you to do stuff like... ward. Don't force outnumbered fights if you can't even win an even-numbered fight. Stall at towers when behind - they're there for a reason. Rotate to pressure a 2nd lane's inhib tower if you killed an inhib instead of fighting in the lane with the dead inhib because it gives you either a 5v4 (someone's gotta be in the other lane to deal with supers) or lets winions take towers while you 5v5 - rather than giving the enemy the chance to 5v5 while they clear supers. Nope, not like any of that simple shit should be known by someone of gold elo or silver. I mean you might have had to be that smart to escape bronze, but clearly your teammates didn't need to be. You might be smart enough to recognize the difference between a bot lane that's intentionally feeding and one that got screwed by repeat 4 man ganks and a tough laning matchup. But your teammates don't have to be smart enough to recognize when you WIN your lane top despite being ganked every 1.75 min, flashed on on cd, roamed on by 8/2/0 fed enemy mid any time you leave tower, and are vs a counter-pick. Your teammates just get to look and criticize you because you aren't grouped to help protect them so they don't die 4v3. How dare you be so selfish as to apply splitpush pressure in a 1v2 scenario, grab a kill, force the other person back to base, and then look to roam and collapse on the enemy 3 man group harassing your teammates - you're team will be dead by that point. How dare you build damage so that at least ONE team member will have damage and do 90% of an enemy carry's max hp in burst damage and lock them down out of position for your team to finish off - while you get perma-cc'd for 5 sec straight and tank 4 enemy's damage and combat summoners; you didn't peel the enemy tank jungler off your adc and she 1v4 killed your 3 squishy carries while you were solo tanking 4 enemies (3 of whom are fed through no fault of your own). Yes, clearly the game was lost because toplaner built damage so he could keep outplaying 1v2 camp of his lane and frequent ganks by fed enemy mid or random flash ganks by fed blitz support and adc. If he'd built full tank instead, he could have forced the sejuani to focus him as well somehow and solo peeled 5 people for his team. Tanking them for a literal 3 min straight before his 3 carries could kill a single enemy because that's how behind they were from inting in lane and jungle. F U C K toplaners like that losing the game for their team that tried so hard and played perfectly.

Bruh just a "bad game" here in riot we do our best but casess like that are not "clear" and they very hard to detect if the players actually "int" we dont want to make zed players who build 6 tears to be afraid to break the meta cause here in riot we love to see non meta builds :) so enjoy this troll in your game and if you dare to tell him that he is a troll you are gonna get banned for 14 days :)

ACTUALL RIOT RESPONDE...

anyone that thinks this isnt clear cut either has brain damage or doesnt want to admit what the obvious decision here should be. The fact that this is 100% inting isnt even debatable its just a fact. I dont understand why riot doesnt want to punish "inters", it would make the game far better.
Riot does want to punish inters, but the data sets they work with are incredibly dirty, from people reporting inting when it's not inting.

I don't know why people don't consider this. Pretty much every other game someone gets reported for "trolling" even if they were just outclassed. It's simply too much work for riot to analyze every report with the amount of detail needed to determine for sure if someone's inting.

Did you report him?

Nothing happens if he didn't get reported.
Did you read what I said? I wasn't in that game, he inted the game i was in he went 1/8 and after his 3rd death inted because the jungler didnt camp him.

Hmm, sorry.

It's possible that he hasn't gotten reported yet: the player isn't flagged if he never gets reported. 

Hard to say without the context of the other players he was with.
But it's hard to detect!

I see a 0/12/2 game in your match history. That's .42 deaths per minute, and 
> [{quoted}](name=le un le seul,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=FcrYRY9M,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-04T21:45:28.463+0000)
>
> Yeah. 21 deaths in 45 minutes is 100% inting. But hey, as you said, it's just a bad game.

this guy says that .46 deaths per minute is 100% inting.

Would you willingly be banned for your performance in that game, or would you rather that punishment is given only for confirmed cases?
No. That's why I asked the question.

You can make a ticket [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). To ask for your account to be deactivated would fall under the "I would like help with account management or changes" option, I believe.

/Edit [This](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202647784) support article gives you the steps you would need to take.
So you believe that people should be punished for intentionally feeding, but when given the opportunity to actually punish one you wont?
